title: Coral reefs, the 6th extinction and you

und.value:
There is growing scientific concern about the health of coral reef ecosystems worldwide, as researchers ponder the possibility of a 6th major extinction episode on Earth, severely limiting the biodiversity of plants and animals.  U.S. Geological Survey scientists are studying coral reef ecosystems to understand why corals are thriving in some areas, but are recognized as being threatened in many others -- is this a harbinger of things to come?

What:    USGS public lecture on coral reefs in Hawai’i

Who:    Mike Field, Senior Marine Geologist
